question: Will New World be a Top 3 game on Steam one month after release?
description:
This is a market on whether New World will be in the Top 3 games on Steam in terms of peak players on October 28, 2021 at 11:59PM ET. Results of this market will be decided by official Steam player counts available at https://store.steampowered.com/stats/. 

The games listed at the resolution source will be ranked from highest to lowest based on the amounts in the "Peak Today" column. In the case of ties, the market will use standard competition ranking ("1224" ranking),  where each game's ranking number is 1 plus the number of games ranked above it.

If New World is in the top 3 or tied for the third spot, the market will resolve "Yes", and otherwise "No." 

In the event the resolution source is not available on October 28, 2021 at 11:59PM ET, another credible source will be chosen. If no other credible sources are available, the sources will be checked every 24 hours until November 28, 2021 when the market will resolve 50-50.

question: (In-game Trading) Will the Yankees or Red Sox win the AL Wild Card game on October 5th?
description: This is a market on whether the New York Yankees or Boston Red Sox will win the American League Wild Card best of one matchup on October 5, 2021, at 8:08 PM ET. This market will resolve to “Yankees” if the Yankees win. If the Red Sox win, it will resolve to “Red Sox.” If the match is postponed to a date on or before November 5, 2021, the same market conditions will apply. If the match is postponed to a date after November 5, 2021, or canceled altogether, the market will resolve 53-47 in favor of “Yankees.”

question: Will 229 million Americans have received at least one dose of an approved Covid-19 vaccination by November 15?
description:
This is a market on whether 229 million people in The United States of America will have initiated vaccination, according to the CDC COVID tracker, by the resolution date, November 15, 2021, 8:00 PM ET. This market will resolve to "Yes" if 229 million people or more are listed as having received their initial dose of vaccination by the resolution source. This only concerns the first dose of vaccination. For vaccines requiring two doses for inoculation, this market considers only the first dose as having initiated vaccination. This market will resolve to "No" if, for any reason, fewer than 229 million people have initiated vaccination by the resolution date. 

The resolution source for this market will be the official data published by the CDC available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations, and will be checked at the resolution time/date. If the website is down, the most recently available data will be used to resolve the market. If the website is not down, this market will resolve according to the data as available immediately at the time of resolution, and resolution will not be delayed for the purpose of waiting for updated data from a specific date.
